revised_title: Effect of Homogeneous and Heterogeneous Reactions on the Dispersion of a Solute in Laminar Flow Between Two Plates
tldr: This article presents an analytical solution for the dispersion of a solute in a liquid flowing between two parallel plates with an irreversible first-order chemical reaction. The effects of both homogeneous and heterogeneous reactions on the dispersion are studied under isothermal conditions. The results show that the effective Taylor diffusion coefficient decreases with an increase in the reaction rate constant for both types of reactions.
